intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Father! Brother! It’s that lady Ike rescued...She’s awake!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Really?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Come on. Let’s greet our guest.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: So, how are you feeling?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Oh, I...I’m fine...And you are?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: The name’s Greil. I’m the commander of this mercenary company.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: My lord Greil...You are the one who came to my aid, are you not? I don’t know how to thank you...

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Hold on. The one who found you and brought you here is my son, Ike. If you want to thank someone, thank him.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: No, please, that’s not–

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Lord...Ike, was it? You have my gratitude.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Oh...

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Pardon my bluntness, but I have some questions for you. Tell me, who are you? What were you doing in that place?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: The place where Ike found you was evidently the site of a fierce battle between Crimean and Daein forces. Do you have some relation to the Crimean royal family?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I make no promises, but we may be able to help you. Will you share your story with us?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: You took me in and cared for me. I will...place my trust in you. Elincia Ridell Crimea. I am the daughter of King Ramon of Crimea.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: You say you are the princess of Crimea?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: That’s an odd claim to make. I’ve never heard of King Crimea having any children.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: That is...to be expected. My heritage, my very existence, has never been made public.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Why’s that?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: To avoid national turmoil. You see, I was born after my uncle, Lord Renning, was named as successor to the throne. So...

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: They kept you a secret to avert a possible blood feud. Yes, I’m willing to accept that for the time being. Very well, let’s suppose that you truly are Princess Crimea. You must know what’s become of the king and your uncle. I would like to hear that news.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: ...My father and my mother are dead...They fell at the hand of Ashnard, King of Daein...My lord uncle and the royal knights are still battling the Daein army, I believe.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: I see.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: ...I...fled the castle...to follow my lord uncle’s orders and seek refuge in the kingdom of Gallia...

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: In Gallia?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: ...Yes. We believed that King Caineghis would grant me sanctuary. So that’s where I was going...But we were discovered by Daein troops, and I lost my escort of knights...My life–the life I have now–was purchased...with the blood of those brave knights...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Does King Daein know of your existence?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Yes. I was told the royals of each nation were informed of my identity in the event of dire circumstances...

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: If that’s the case, they must be searching frantically for you.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Master Greil, my lord Ike, you said that you were mercenaries, did you not? Please...Would you help me to gain Gallia? I beg of you! I have...no one...no one else to turn to.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Princess Crimea? Truly?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Father spoke to her as if he believed she were telling the truth.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: I see...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What is it, Titania?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Mm, it’s nothing. I was just remembering something from the past.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: From the past? Back when you were still a Crimean royal knight?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: What? How do you know about that?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: A long time ago, I overheard Shinon and some others talking about it.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: They keep such loose tongues.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Was it a secret?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: No, it wasn’t, but...Much like I have more experience than you, I also have many more things to worry about.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Like Princess Crimea?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Well...yes. I myself was unaware of the princess’s existence, but...Now that I think about it, she does bear a striking resemblance to both the king and queen.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So she probably is the true princess. I wonder what Father will do. Will he take on her request?

intro.speaker: Rolf
intro.line: We’ve got trouble! There are soldiers! A lot of them!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Is everyone here?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Shinon
intro.line: Commander, what are the Daein dogs saying?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Turn over Princess Crimea and leave the area immediately. Comply now, or we will attack.Pretty straightforward.

intro.speaker: Gatrie
intro.line: What are we going to do?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: That’s what we’re here to decide. One thing has been made clear by the arrival of our friends outside.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: So, I would say this confirms her identity as Princess Crimea, wouldn’t you?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Yes, but what do we do now? I’d like to hear the opinion of everyone here. Titania,I’d like to hear from you first.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: The blame for this war rests on Daein. If we ally ourselves with them,the company’s reputation will surely suffer. Conversely, if we deliver Princess Crimea safely, our stock will risein the eyes of our primary employers. Our road is clear.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Soren, how about you?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: There’s nothing to think about. We must deliver the princess to Daein immediately.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Even if Crimea is in the right?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: We are mercenaries. Our actions are dictated only by self-interest. If we want to ensure our future, we need Daein in our debt. They will win this war, after all, and nothing else serves us better.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Shinon? Gatrie?

intro.speaker: Shinon
intro.line: Soren’s a pompous, superior whelp, but he’s got the right idea. Besides, the destination’s Gallia, so it’s a moot question. I don’t care how much we get paid; there’s no way under the sun I’m going to stinking beast country.

intro.speaker: Gatrie
intro.line: Princess Elincia...She does possess a certain regal beauty... There’s a lot to be said for that, you know. However I do prefer country girls...A bit cuter, and not quite so standoffish...Oh! Forget I said that.Whatever you decide is good for me, Commander. Yep, uh-huh, yep...

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Oscar, Boyd, what about the two of you?

intro.speaker: Oscar
intro.line: I agree with Captain Titania. If we turn the princess over to the Daein army, we’re essentially giving them permission to kill her.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: I’m in favor of helping her. That’s what heroes are supposed to do.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Well, Rhys? What’s your opinion?

intro.speaker: Rhys
intro.line: I believe...that none of this hinges on whether she’s a princess or not. Refusing to aid someone in need is not something we should ever do. That’s what I think.

intro.speaker: Rolf
intro.line: That’s right! Let’s help her!

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Please! We have to help her!

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: And what about you, Ike?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I agree with Titania. I say we help her and take her to Gallia.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: I see. I think I know where you all stand.......Well then, here’s my decision.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: We escort the princess to Gallia.

intro.speaker: Shinon
intro.line: ...Tsk.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: ...Are you sure that’s for the best, Father?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Yes. Besides, I think the choice has been taken out of our hands.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Open your ears and listen. Listen! All of you.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Huh?...What is it?

intro.speaker: Gatrie
intro.line: Uh...I don’t hear a thing...

intro.speaker: Shinon
intro.line: Idiot! That’s the problem. Don’t you think that’s a bit odd? Complete silence, in all four directions.

intro.speaker: Gatrie
intro.line: Oh, so that’s what you’re talking about!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We’re surrounded. The soldiers aren’t waiting for an answer. They already decided to attack.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: It would appear they had no intention of keeping their side of the proposed bargain.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: They were planning on lulling us into a false sense of security and destroying every one of us.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Probably so. But the deal is, we’re not so naive or inexperienced as to fall for their trap. take your positions! We’re going to settle this right now!

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: I’ll go and hold the rear entrance. Ike! You’re in command here! Don’t let the enemy take the front.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: ...Got it! Be careful, Commander!

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Hah. I’ll give it a shot.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Reporting in, sir! The mercenaries have taken up arms and formed up in the bailey!

intro.speaker: Dakova
intro.line: Oh...so they’ve sniffed out our plan, have they? Which means they’re not an opponent that will be easily fooled. We’ll need something special.[

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Shall we continue with the planned attack?

intro.speaker: Dakova
intro.line: No...Princess Crimea is somewhere within that fort. If we use flaming arrows to try to smoke them out, we might bring the princess to harm. We’ve been told to do our best to deliver her alive and uninjured. It would be preferable if they were to come out of their own accord. If they do, slay all but the princess!

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir!

boss.speaker: Dakova
boss.line: What’s going on? Weren’t they supposed to be completely surrounded?

battle.speaker: Dakova
battle.line: Grr...How’ve they lasted this long? Just who are these mercenaries? Knowing your enemy’s strength is vital to any strategy...Soldiers! Retreat! We fall back for now!

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: General Dakova! No, not...the general...Not at the hands of these scum...I will not allow it! Aaaaah! Face me, and breathe your last, you wretched scum!

battle.speaker: Soren
battle.line: Ike! The enemy’s taken the fort!

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Oh no! Mist and the others...

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: We’ve cleared the surrounding area of Daein troops.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: There’s no question about it. We’re enemies of the Daein kingdom now, aren’t we?

end.speaker: Greil
end.line: We’ve no time for rest! Everyone, pack your things now! We leave at once, before the enemy brings reinforcements!

end.speaker: Oscar
end.line: Understood! Boyd! Come with me.

end.speaker: Boyd
end.line: Right behind you, Brother!

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Ah! We’ve got to hurry, too! Come on, Rolf! We’ve got to pack as much food and supplies as we can!

end.speaker: Rolf
end.line: Uh, whatever you say! Let’s go, Mist!

end.speaker: Greil
end.line: Titania! Take Shinon and Gatrie and make sure we have a secure road from here to the great forest. We’ll make our way to Gallia through the sea of trees.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: On my way, sir!

end.speaker: Greil
end.line: Rhys, you stay with me. I want you to help me pull essential documents from the library. Everything else we burn.

end.speaker: Rhys
end.line: Y-yes, sir!

end.speaker: Greil
end.line: Ike! You’re in charge of the princess.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: All right.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Princess Elincia! I’m going to ready a horse for you. What should we have you do...I know–go to the mess hall.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I’m sorry?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Time will go by faster if you’re helping Mist than it will if you’re just sitting around waiting for me.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Oh, I understand. I can do that!

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Sorry, this is kind of awkward. Making a princess help with packing...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Please don’t worry, Mist. I just hope that I don’t end up slowing you down by getting in your way.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Don’t be silly! You’re so much better at this than I am. It’s a big help! Are all princesses as good at this sort of thing as you are?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Ha ha! I wasn’t raised at court, so my life was a bit different than other princesses. I cooked,cleaned, sewed...Why, I did all manner of things.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Really? That’s surprising. I would never have guessed that by looking at you.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Let’s see, I also rode horses, practiced swordfighting...Ah, Mist. What’s that around your neck?

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: What? Oh, ah...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to...

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: ...I guess I can show it to you, Princess Elincia.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Oh...It’s a lovely... That’s an incredible medallion, isn’t it? I wonder what that light is.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: It used to belong to my mother. It’s all I have to remember her by. Hmm...I don’t know where the light comes from. It didn’t used to be like that. A while back, it just started glowing.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: The world is full of mysteries, isn’t it? One thing is clear, though...It certainly is beautiful.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: I wonder what that light means...

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: What? What did you just say? I think I must be hearing things. I thought you said, They got away.

end.speaker: Dakova
end.line: Ge-General Petrine. I am deeply ashamed. By my honor...

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Honor? I care nothing for your pathetic honor. Have you forgotten the Daein army’s motto? Success or failure, life or death. Hey, you! Get this trash out of here!

end.speaker: Daein Soldier
end.line: Yes, ma’am! Move it, you.

end.speaker: Dakova
end.line: W-wait! General Petrine, have mercy...

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Dog’s breath! I’m surrounded by worthless imbeciles. Ena!

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Tell me which way we should move to catch these mercenaries and the girl.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: ...The Crimean capital, Melior, is already under King Ashnard’s control...The remnants of the Crimean army are neglible...Which means the only place left for the princess to turn is south, to the kingdom of Gallia.

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: Hah! So the girl, like her dead father before her, seeks the friendship of those hairy devils, eh? What an absolutely stupefying world we live in.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: If she gains sanctuary in Gallia, capturing the princess will become that much more difficult....The mercenaries she has escorting her are a powerful group, not one to be taken lightly. I will gather intelligence on them as quickly as...

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: It’s not necessary. I will head up the pursuit of our wandering princess.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: General Petrine, you will go...yourself?

end.speaker: Petrine
end.line: If we know where the princess and her band are headed, there’s no need for subtlety. I’ll just hunt them down and kill them. Mercenaries? Hah! What’re they to me? Remember, I am General Petrine! No matter who I face, I have never failed, nor will I ever! Ha ha ha...
